scenario_text.value:
We made it to the shrine interior without
running into Pinochimon or his minions...

Is our destination truly up ahead? I admit
I have my doubts...
The path to the lowest level is through here.
Yo, this door ain’t budging an inch!
Hmm... Should we break it down?

I wouldn’t, if I were you. The enemy will be
upon us in mere moments.

Besides, I bet smashing this thing’s easier
said than done.
Huh, you think?

After all the weird things we’ve seen? Maybe
it’s sealed with a special power...

She’s right. The Master’s past here, so
a barrier like that makes sense.

Then how’re we supposed to open it? Some
magic words? Or maybe a key?
I don’t see any hole for a key or nothing.
How do we get inside, Renamon?

In the past, I used to go in with the
Master’s underlings...

Oh, one of them pressed an object to the
door. A Magatama, I think.

I see. A Magatama, then? It seems that is the
key to this door.
How do you know that?

Magatamas are beads with mysterious power,
used as wards or talismans in ancient times.

Then we just have to look for this magma-
tummy thing!
Fine, but...how do we do that?

I bet Pinochimon’s minions have it. We should
look for them.

After all the effort we went through to sneak
in here, now we gotta seek them out?!

An absurd state of affairs, but here we find
ourselves.

We can’t go forward without snatching that
Magatama out of the enemy’s mitts.
Oh no... So we have to steal it...

Is there any way we can get them to hand it
over?

I understand how you feel, Aoi, but nothing
we can say will change their minds.

They hate all of us as much as they hate
Gabumon here.

But... The Master’s just tricking Pinochimon,
isn’t he?

Hmm... Why don’t we see if there’s another
Magatama around here somewhere?

Sorry, I’m afraid that’s nigh-impossible.
I’ve walked around the shrine many times...
Not once did I spot an item to that effect.
Whaaat?! Then what the heck should we do?

(The Magatama is a must if we’re gonna open
this door.)

(As things stand, stealing it from
Pinochimon’s crew is our best bet...)

(But the ones we’d be fighting are just being
tricked by the Master, like they said.)

(And yet, I can’t imagine any way we could
persuade those guys...)

(Saki mentioned looking for another Magatama.
Is that even possible? I highly doubt it...)
(To open this door, we should...)
Talk to Pinochimon.
Steal from Pinochimon.
Find another Magatama.
Talk to Pinochimon.

They may be our enemy, but the fact is
they’re also victims of the Master’s lies.

Why don’t we search them out, and try to talk
them into handing over the Magatama?

There’s no chance they’ll hear us out. Did
you forget the last battle?

Gabumon’s right. Their blind faith in the
Master is unshakable.
I doubt we can avoid a fight.
Guess there’s no choice... We gotta steal it.
Man... All right, if you say so.
Steal from Pinochimon.

If Pinochimon’s group has the Magatama, we
should track them down and take it.
Takuma...
Is there really no other way?

Unfortunately not. Those guys hold a huge
grudge against us...

Yeah... They didn’t have ears to listen to
us—or ear holes, anyway.
Exactly. I think this is the best option.

If we find Pinochimon, there’ll be a fight
either way... We’d better be ready.

Yes... I guess this is inevitable. And this
is all to rescue Miyuki...

I understand... I won’t run from this. I’ll
fight, too!
Find another Magatama.

This is a long shot, but... Should we see if
there’s another Magatama somewhere?
Is your head screwed on properly, my boy?

The professor just said he ain’t ever seen
another one around here, didn’t he?
Ugh... Yeah, so he did...

I’m sorry to reject your proposal so readily,
Takuma...

But Magatamas are not natural formations.
Unless the enemy drops one, we won’t find it.

And I hardly expect them to just oopsie-
daisy something so important onto the ground.

In other words... Finding a dropped Magatama
around here is next to impossible.
(Man... Everyone’s ganging up on me...)

Sorry. I just suggested it without thinking.
We really need to look for Pinochimon.
Yeah, that’s probably a good bet.
Got it. Let’s all look for Pinochimon.

Okay, if we’re all done talking, let’s track
down Pinochimon and the others!

They must be lurking around this shrine
somewhere.

We just gotta find the hidden enemy! We’ve
done that tons of times already!
Isn’t that right, Takuma!
Yeah! I’m counting on you, Agumon!
Let’s go, guys!
